landing.bio: I am a Software Engineer at DRW interested in algorithmics, research, optimisation, machine learning, full-stack development and generally applied Computer Science. I enjoy problem solving, creative thinking, learning and all-round development. I dislike too much monotony and stagnation.

projects.name: Music generation
projects.description: This was my 3rd year dissertation project at the University of Cambridge. During the seven months of allocated time, I developed and evaluated three music generation methods: two variants of recurrent neural networks that use the attention mechanism and a Markov chain. Moreover, I published a dynamic web application that was used to evaluate the music against other music generation methods like a random generator, a state of the art music generator and a human composer. The website also allows for real-time music generation using the Markov chain. Apart from that, I designed an algorithm to flag plagiarism in music pieces. The video presented here contains a walk-through of the web application.
projects.technologies: Python and its libraries i.a. Music21, Tensorflow, Keras, Magenta, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Numpy, Pandas;  FFmpeg; FluidSynth; React Native; JavaScript; CSS; Express.js; Node.js; Linux - high-performance computing, dynamic web hosting; LaTeX

projects.name: Hero
projects.description: Me and my teammates solved a problem prevalent in third world countries. In some places in the world it takes more than 40 minutes for an ambulance to reach an accident's scene. Through our system eligible people can register and be notified by an ambulance dispatcher about an accident in their vicinity so that the help can be given as fast as possible. The project won two awards during Oxford Hackathon 2019 and we decided to improve it and submit it for the Microsoft Imagine Cup competition. My task was to create the React Native front-end and integrate it with the back-end developed by my peers. The youtube video you see contains a demonstration of the front-end at the end.
projects.technologies: React Native, JavaScript, CSS, Firebase platform

projects.name: Machine learning tutoring
projects.technologies: IPython in Google Colaboratory; Python and its libraries i.a. Scikit-learn, Numpy, Pandas, Tensorflow, Keras, Matplotlib
projects.description: As a tutor, together with my student we went through practical fundamentals of machine learning. The main topics we covered: linear regression, logistic regression, support vector machines, decision trees, ensemble learning and random forests, dimensionality reduction, unsupervised learning techniques, basic neural networks, convolutional neural networks, recurrent neural networks, natural language processing, autoencoders, generative adversarial networks, reinforcement learning, tutorial of tensorflow 2.0, advanced tensorflow/IPython tools, basics of quantum computing in machine learning. For each topics we went through practical implementations in python with thorough understanding and experimentation.

projects.name: Green eyes
projects.description: The project was part of my Computer Science studies at the University of Cambridge. Together in a group of 5 students we created an application for Microsoft Hololens that evaluates the impact of an item on the environment given a picture of the item. The project was supervised by the IMC Trading company. My responsibilities were to develop the look and the logic behind the GUI on Microsoft Hololens.

projects.name: Purgo space
projects.description: Together with 3 of my friends we created a piece of software to tackle the issue of trash in cities. One part of the solution is a mobile application that shows you on a map where trashes and bins are so that you could scan a trash with your camera, put it in a bin and earn up to 5 pounds in voucher rewards. The map also shows you how full each bin is (we developed a piece of hardware that could be put inside bins to check for this). Apart from the mobile application we also developed a web application for people overseeing the project and a machine learning algorithm that could detect trashes on the streets from video footage of cameras that are attached to cars/public transport so that we have the data to put in the mobile application. The project was created during the 'Hack Cambridge 2020' hackathon and won two awards: 'Green IoT - best use of IoT in a project that tackles environmental issue' and 'MongoDB challenge - best use of MongoDB database'. My job was creating back-end for the project. I set up communication between hardware and mobile front-end and I built a database of users and trashes. I also helped with developing the web application front-end.
projects.technologies: MongoDB, JavaScript, Express.js, Node.js, AngularJS, Microsoft Azure services

projects.name: Catch me if you can
projects.description: A 2-player game in which you try to catch the other player in a limited amount of time on a playground with a lot of obstacles. I created the game with my friend in the Unity framework during the Game Gig 2019 hackathon in Cambridge.

projects.name: Weather app
projects.description: Together with 4 other students from my year we created a weather application in JavaFX that lets you display and customize the display of current weather conditions for different cities around the world, The desktop application was developed for the Interactive Design course from the first year of the Computer Science course at the University of Cambridge.

projects.name: BlokeChain
projects.description: Together with 3 other friends we created a decentralized application to verify medical prescriptions using TODA protocol. The project won the People's choice award during the Cambridge-Bradfield hackathon 2019.
projects.technologies: Blockchain, TODA protocol, React, JavaScript, CSS

projects.name: SuPORT
projects.description: Together with 2 of my friends we created a mobile app that gives users real-time information about current state of different sport centres/playing fields (number of people occupying the object, whether they are actively playing etc.) so that it's easier for users to group up for team sports. We created the project during the spring edition of the 'Wawcode 2019' hackathon and we won 2nd place award. I was in charge of developing the mobile application and my friends developed machine learning models used for analyzing CCTV footages.

projects.name: PDF combiner
projects.description: I created a simple end-to-end program to preview, extract and combine pages from different pdfs together with images. It was the first time I used Tkinter python framework for GUI creation. I did it for a private use and to have some learning and fun over the winter break.

projects.name: Luno challenge
projects.description: Together with 2 other friends we built a trading bot for the Luno exchange and run it on my Raspberry Pi 4B. We created the bot to take part in the Luno challenge which was one of the challenges in the Spark University Hackathon. During 8 weeks of the hackathon we tried and utilised the common trading techniques like arbitrage, moving averages and linear regression to trade with different cryptocurrencies. We ended up making profit of around 40 dollars and finished the hackathon on the 5th position (from around 30 teams).

projects.name: WiFi Fever
projects.description: A game in which you have to place an object (a router) so that the sum of the distances from other objects (phones) is the smallest possible. I created the game in the Love2D framework during the Game Gig 2018 hackathon in Cambridge. It was the first hackathon I participated in.

projects.name: Educational webpage
projects.description: I created an interactive website popularizing inversion, a very useful transformation in geometry, using the funds from the Mazovian scholarship for talented students. Sadly, after a few years of online presence, the webpage is no longer available on the internet.

presentations.original_title: Deep Learning in Medical Imaging - a Practical Introduction
presentations.description: I was honoured to have the opportunity to present during a conference about the use of AI in radiological diagnostics. I gave a talk that introduces participants to the world of deep learning, medical imaging and deep learning applied to medical imaging. I finished the presentation with a practical walk-through of the code I created to solve a simple pneumonia detection problem.
